misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct loop-nesting for pattern printing)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that using a nested loop where the inner loop prints i asterisks for row i will build the required right-triangle pattern.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap detected. Java executes the outer loop once per row (i from 1..n). For each row, the inner loop runs j from 1..i printing exactly i asterisks, then a newline is printed, matching the specification.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None; produces the correct output for all non-negative integer inputs where n>=1 (and for n<=0 it prints nothing, which is a reasonable default though not specified).
